definition: to inject funds/to put money into (the market)
to inject/to pour into/to concentrate/to pay attention/stake (gambling)/classifier for sums of money/variant of 註|注[zhu4]

sentences.english: Banks need to be recapitalized for the recovery process to begin.
sentences.chinese: 銀行要重新注資，以啓動復甦進程。

sentences.english: Chinese-owned enterprises have pumped money into Zambia's mining sector in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年來，中資企業一直在向贊比亞的採礦業注資。

sentences.english: The politics of allocating government funds to recapitalize banks is not easy.
sentences.chinese: 用政府資金爲銀行注資所帶來的政治問題不易解決。

sentences.english: The new capital injections should help.
sentences.chinese: 新的注資將能提供幫助。

sentences.english: China Southern has not announced any change to the amount it will receive .
sentences.chinese: 中國南航尚未宣佈它將得到的注資金額會有任何變動。

sentences.english: Abu Dhabi bails out its neighbour. What will it ask in return?
sentences.chinese: 阿布扎比向鄰國注資。它會要求回報嗎？

sentences.english: He had them sign pledge cards agreeing to take the money.
sentences.chinese: 他還讓這些銀行巨頭簽了承諾書，一致同意接受注資。

sentences.english: Weaning China off these credit injections is not easy.
sentences.chinese: 要讓中國擺脫這樣的信貸注資並不容易。

sentences.english: If you got the right idea, you will get some funding.
sentences.chinese: 如果你找到正確的方法，就能得到注資。

sentences.english: A major U.S. bank will need to be recapitalized.
sentences.chinese: 美國一大型銀行將需要重新注資。

sentences.english: 'It would be short-sighted if we only focus on a one-off capital injection, ' he said.
sentences.chinese: 他說，如果我們只關注一次性注資，那將是短視的。

definition: to purchase (from various places)/to acquire (a company)
merger and acquisition (M and A)/acquisition/to take over
to fund/to put money into sth/to invest
